hints.content: The scale is counting up by $20$s.

The bar for Snow Slope lines up with $\blueD{40}$ on the scale.   The bar for Blizzard Run lines up with $\purpleD{70}$ on the scale.  


[[☃ image 1]]

Which hill is more than $\blueD{40}$ meters tall, but less than $\purpleD{70}$ meters tall?

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Height in meters and the vertical axis labeled Sledding Hill. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 20, 40, 60, and 80. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Blizzard Run, Winter Hill, Snow Slope, and Frozen Field. The bar line for each sledding hill shows the following: Blizzard Run bar line extends to the middle of 60 and 80, Winter Hill bar line extends to 60, Snow Slope bar line extends to 40, and Frozen Field bar line extends to the middle of 0 and 20. A blue line labeled 40 is drawn up from 40, which reaches to the end of Snow Slope bar line. A purple line labeled 70 is drawn up from 70, which reaches to the end of Blizzard Run bar line. !

hints.content:
[[☃ image 1]]

Winter Hill is $\greenD{60}$ meters tall.

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Height in meters and the vertical axis labeled Sledding Hill. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 20, 40, 60, and 80. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Blizzard Run, Winter Hill, Snow Slope, and Frozen Field. The bar line for each sledding hill shows the following: Blizzard Run bar line extends to the middle of 60 and 80, Winter Hill bar line extends to 60, Snow Slope bar line extends to 40, and Frozen Field bar line extends to the middle of 0 and 20. A green line labeled 60 is drawn up from 60, which reaches to the end of Winter Hill bar line. !

hints.content: $\greenD{\text{Winter Hill}}$ is higher than Snow Slope but lower than Blizzard Run.

question.content:
Dina measured the heights of her favorite snow day sledding hills and graphed the results.  


[[☃ image 1]]

**Which hill is higher than Snow Slope but lower than Blizzard Run?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Height in meters and the vertical axis labeled Sledding Hill. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 20, 40, 60, and 80. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Blizzard Run, Winter Hill, Snow Slope, and Frozen Field. The bar line for each sledding hill shows the following: Blizzard Run bar line extends to the middle of 60 and 80, Winter Hill bar line extends to 60, Snow Slope bar line extends to 40, and Frozen Field bar line extends to the middle of 0 and 20. !
